Reviews.Title: “Good quality/price”
Reviews.Author: crislondon08
Reviews.Content: Very close to Pigalle Metro the hotel it's a 2 stars but very good for the price. Room is small like every room in Paris, but it's clean and beds are confortable. Unfortunatly bathroom it's very tiny and need to be re-done but for the price was perfect. Breakfast it's included with one big croissant and half baguette each person, jam,butter and cheese and bevarages. People were nice and I find this hotel perfect for it's price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: OliviaBrazil
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights at St. georges Lafayette as part of plane ticket + lodging program. Sheets and towels are clean, but very small room (well, that´s Paris). Breakfast is very poor. Small glass of orange juice, one cup of coffee, little butter and very little cream cheese. One croissant and half a baguette. And that´s it. Cable TV in the room is very limited. No phone or interphone working in the room. Location is very convenient, though. Close to metro station, supermarket and very nice restaurants. Well, once in Paris you come to the hotel just to sleep, so... it´s OK. Front desk staff always very helpful. Rooms very quiet over the night, but a very simple hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ian001
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel near Pigalle Metro station. Close to Montmatre / Sacre Coeur and Moulin Rouge - a great area of Paris. Good value - room rate included continental breakfast. Slight problem at first with the room we were given (which was dingy, musty and had a broken shower base) but, after complaining (and being told that we should have booked a 3-star hotel!) we were given another room which was fine. Continental breakfast with croissant, bread, cheese spread, jam and coffee. Good base from which to explore Paris using public transport. Recommend buying a (daily) travel pass for metro/RER/bus (&funicular!) (or possibly a carnet of 10 single tickets) to explore Paris (and possibly Versailles). Relax in La Fourmi bar (74 rue des Martyrs, 100 metres west of Pigalle Metro) - good ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Paris !”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: Our experience was wondering, the hotel was clean and the staff was nice and friendly. It was nice to see a smiling face each morning at breakfast time, just like being a home. The rooms are small, but they are defintiley clean and always have fresh towels. Really felt like we were at "home". It was close to everything and walking distance to the train stations etc. And if I ever needed directions to get somewhere, I could always find an aswer at the front desk... and at time to return (which I really did not want to return) they were wonderful enough to coordiante the taxi to pick us up on time and not fear to lose our flight.. I highly recomment this hotel and its wonderful staff.. and I hav learned its not what the "stars" are on the hotel wall, but its how they treat you, with respect, care and making you feel safe... ! Thank you all and surely look forward to seeing you again in 2013! Can't wait .... hugs from Boston...

Reviews.Title: “Ok place, but cheap for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pramath18
Reviews.Content: Really tiny room, but I guess if you are traveling Paris on the budget. It's a good deal. Close to the train station, walkable, they do not have internet you have to buy extra and the locality is ok, close to pigalle which is apparently a red light area :P .. but you don't need to go that side unless you have to take a metro.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzi_j
Reviews.Content: There were a number of bad reviews on this hotel but we thought we'd give it a chance...and I'm so glad we did!! We arrived quite late at night but were greeted immediately by a very friendly man. His English was not the best, and my French is far from perfect but he really tried his best, showed us our location on the map, local points of interest etc. and even swapped our friends room so that we were all on the same floor! The hotel is less than 5 mins walk from the nearest Metro station, Pigalle, which connects you to everywhere! We were going to a concert at the Omnisport du Bercy and the hotel staff told us exactly what to do and we got there with ease. It is also just a 10 minute walk from Moulin Rouge and 15 minutes from Sacre Cour. It's perfectly located! The only people who have complained on here are crazy! So there might be a little chip in the paintwork, the shower door might not be perfect. If these things bother you, pay 200 Euro's a night for somewhere....I bet the service won't be a patch on this hotel! Also, breakfast was served each morning consisting of bread, cheese, croissant, juice and a hot drink. Nothing fancy but ideal to set you up for a day sightseeing. I would definitely stay here again and I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “A great value Budget hotel in Pigalle area”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMFriendly
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel advertised on Last Minute.com for a fantastic rate of £115 for 2 nights B&B in Paris! Situated very close to the Pigalle Metro but Rue Victor Masse is pretty quiet compared to the nearby debauchary! My husband and I love this area of Paris, as it's only a 10 minute walk to Abscesses and Montmartre. The room was perfectly adequate and recently updated, so more modern than the photos suggest. There was plenty of hot water ( although the shower head wasn't attached to the wall) I asked for a quiet room as I was there to run the marathon and we were given exactly that. I had 2 great nights sleep. The breakfast was fine, a baguette and a croissant with jam/cheese. The staff in the hotel were all extremely pleasant and ignored the fact that we were 15 minutes late checking out. They were also happy to store our bags when we arrived far too early to check in. I would recommend this to anyone who isn't offended by the Pigalle area ( the street always felt safe) and who fancies spending their cash in Paris instead of on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value for money.”
Reviews.Author: keefjones
Reviews.Content: On arrival, there were two green wheelie bins in the foyer - a foretaste of the hotel experience. Throughout the three-day stay there was an cleaning gear cupboard open in the foyer. The bedroom was cramped, superficially clean but dirty in the detail - for example, the radiator grilles and the net curtains. There was no drawer space provided at all, just one 2 1/2 foot by 1 foot alcove with half a dozen coat hangers on a rail for both of us and our luggage. Decor was 1970's chic. There was one pillow on each side of the bed with one spare pillow in the top of the aforementioned alcove. There was no waste bin in the bedroom, just a very small one in the bathroom. Street noise was excessive, even with the window closed. As there was no air conditioning, leaving the window closed was not a preferred option. There was a fan provided but it turned out to be non-operational. On taking it down to reception the young lad merely gave a rather expert gallic shrug and I returned to the room empty-handed. The bathroom had a shower cubicle with a (torn) shower curtain that was too large so that showering involved the experience of being embraced by a clammy mass of nylon. The hot tap on the sink was almost completely seized and I got plenty of exercise wrestling with it until there was enough water forthcoming to wash my hands. The sink plug did not lift properly so that water took a long while to drain away. Hand towels were not provided, but the management seemed to have attempted to address this shortcoming by providing bath towels that were almost as small as hand towels. On the last day, no towels were provided at all and it took the manager considerable effort to drag himself away from the football match on the television in order to go off and find some for me. The breakfast was the piece de resistance, in the local parlance. There were no plates provided - just sheets of paper on which were tastefully dumped a portion of jam - cheap label, a portion of cheese spread - cheap label, a portion of butter and two sugar lumps. Breakfast, when delivered, was a croissant each and a piece of french stick. The coffee was warm, not hot. The one good thing was that the orange juice appeared to be freshly squeezed. Unfortunately it was squeezed into a very small glass. All-in-all, a memorable stay for all the wrong reasons and the worst stay of many in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: bluerune19
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fantastic. The hotel staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable including using their car without question or compensation to transport us in an emergency. Close to Metro, lots of good restaurants in area.

Reviews.Title: “No frills - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: AndrewLeicester
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a package through Eurostar. The location was very convenient (15 min walk from Gare Du Nord) 2 mins from Pigalle Metro. The room was small a bit tatty but clean and comfortable for a short break. Breakfast was included in the price it consisted of a bagette, croussiant, coffee and orange juice, not very exciting but we found it adequate. The area around the hotel is interesting in one direction you have the notorious Pigalle but there are also lots of nice bars and restaurants nearby in Monmartre

Reviews.Title: “small, clean but bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: linneapee123
Reviews.Content: hotel was really small, tiny stairs and even smaller rooms. we couldn't get a good temperature in our rooms, it was either really cold or really hot. i would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget, but i would NOT recommend the neighborhood. We were two girls in Paris and it was really scary, almost all the time. We got comments everywere we went, and at night it was really unpleasant. The metro station nearby, Pigalle is not nice place to be at dark. Another bad thing about the neighborhood was that there were no cafÃ©es nearby, only sex-shops, haha.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, well located”
Reviews.Author: shokkas
Reviews.Content: My wife took me to Paris for my 30th birthday and she booked this hotel based on price and other trip advisor's reviews of it (we stayed there Oct 7-Oct 11). The hotel is a basic 2* hotel. There is a tiny lobby mainly used by staff who were VERY kind, polite and extremely helpful! Every question we had and every need was answered quickly, with a smile and in a positive attitude. The rooms are rather small â€“ just for the bed and not much else (there is a small table and night stands). The room and bathroom were very clean and tidy and were nice to go into. 2 problems with the bathroom â€“ 1. Sink and toilet water tank cover were cracked (see photos) - still clean though and no leaks. 2. If you are tall (above 1.70 meters), and you get the street facing right corner room, you might need to sit on your knees to shower â€“ I know I did. Why you ask? Well, the shower is not roomy to begin with, and in that room location, there is a concrete belt going right through the middle of the shower part ceiling (see photo). Breakfast â€“ we discovered that what we thought to be a joke, is actually the common thing in other hotels and restaurants - small orange juice glass, coffee or tea, small butter, small jab, small cheese, quarter baget and croision per person. No plate. Knife and teaspoon. My wife used to order the tea and as it came on a napkin and plate, she put the cup aside and used the plate as plate. We didnâ€™t â€“ but other guests asked for more butter/baget and such with no problems. Just opposite the hotel, there is a VERY RECCOMNEDED restaurant called Pile Poele. Excellent food and service. Owner speak very well English and had great two set menus. In out 4 nights stay we ate there twice. Also on the street crossing the hotelâ€™s street there are several cheese shops, bakeries and other restaurants. There is a small supermarket (Carrefour) which is open 9:00-23:30 all days but Sunday. The Scare Coeur is about 8 minutes walk. There are close Metro station and taxi station in Pigalle circus. The Hotel is not to be pampered at. It is functional easy to get to and a good "camp" to have while touring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Business Ethics of St Georges Lafayette Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jpfyeung
Reviews.Content: This event took place on September 24th 2009. The worst nightmare to any travelers is when you turned up at the hotel after a long haul flight, the man behind the counter told you that your booking is confirmed and validated but we do not have a room for you as we are fully booked at the moment. You then started to question them â€œwhy?â€� as the room is booked and confirmed beforehand. The man replied â€œdonâ€™t complain to me, I am only an employeeâ€�. Then he started to make a few phone calls and pull out a map on the desk and told me in broken English to go to another hotel. All directions and landmarks are in French which makes it very tough for me to find as I was very tired and hungry. It took me 30 minutes to walk there and to give you a feel on the distance, it is from one Metro(Subway) station to another. The hotel that was arranged is among the red light district with sex shops on either side. My room is on second floor and facing the back street that is full of cabarets, pee show parlors and of course bars. I checked in on Thursday and left on Sunday. The parties at the back street went on every evening starting from 7pm to 7am the next morning. It was so noisy that I simply cannot sleep. I am extremely upset with Hotel Saint Georges Lafayette in Paris. The Hotel management has no business ethics and integrity. It has totally sabotage my 4 daysâ€™ stay in Paris and I do not recommend anyone contemplate to book this hotel or nor should you allow your agent to book this hotel unless you want to get into the trouble that I have encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value ...what you'd expect for this price.”
Reviews.Author: mooncup
Reviews.Content: Got this as part of a very cheap EURO STAR package Spent one night in Paris so just wanted a clean , basic hotel Got a very clean room.yes, the room is dated and 1950's but it was tidy. I didn't need any more than this. (I wouldn't really bother with going down for breakfast though..it was just a coissant and coffee or orange juice..no plates) Yes, it is near the red light district but we had no bother and it was relatively quiet, although I do take earplugs everywhere just in case Helpful , friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: MrMayhem
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite basic - BUT - I think, it's a very nice hotel for people who travel on a budget. The location is very good, just in the heart of the red light district of Paris - but no worries, we all felt very safe, even after midnight and you are able to walk to the city center and the various sights in less than 30 minutes. Of course there's a metro-station about 5 minutes from the hotel. The manager was very friendly, he showed us the best way to walk down to place de la concorde and get the nicest sights on the way. Staff was also quite friendly. The breakfast is VERY basic and is served in the basement of the hotel - not especially appealing but if you look at the room rates, it's quite ok. Rooms also were basic but clean. I would absolutely book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “I've enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: supergirl23
Reviews.Content: I've just came back from a 3 night break in Paris, stayed in the hotel St. Georges Lafayette and I thought it was good enough. It was the first time when I went to Paris and the weather was lovely. The hotel is situated in the Red Light district and there are some sex shops on your way to the hotel, but we didn't have any problems even when coming back late at night. It felt quiet and safe to be honest, however I wouldn't recommend this area for families with children probably...The room was quite compact with small bathroom, but we haven't spent too much time in the hotel anyway. The breakfast was small as well, but it was enough for me and it was typically French. It was perfect base to see all of the attraction as the Metro is conveniently situated from the hotel (5mins walk). It is a budget hotel so don't expect marble on the floor, just enjoy Paris itself!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value but not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Designerteacher
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night break for myself through Expedia. I have been to Paris a few times some years ago and wanted a hotel that was in a good location to vist other attractions. I did not want a chain hotel with no character. I was very pleased with this place, you are only paying Â£50 per night includung breakfast in the centre of Paris. The same type of hotel in London would be three time the price. I list the good and not so good Good; Excellent location, the red light didtrict is safe, their are lots of people around even in the small hours. Clean room and bedding. Fan provided Beds made up for you Good shower and toilet facilities Double glazed windows to keep out the street noise Good size room Basic but nice breakfast fresh orange juice Staff try to be helpful but their English is limited but not as much as my French. Not so good ( I am being fussy) A bit tatty around the edges Bleach spilt on stair carpet and landing areas Horrible stretched pvc ceiling in room that was ripped Lift floor could do with a good clean No wardrobe, just 4 hangers under a small shelf.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Greatest place, but Location is nice and convenient...”
Reviews.Author: GlobalWoman2008
Reviews.Content: Hotel St. Georges Lafayette is in the ninth district on a very small street in Paris. Very close to the eighteenth district. If you walk up about a half a mile (prepare for a steep walk) you will reach Sacre Coeur. The location was very convenient, lots of cafe's, places to eat, metro was about two blocks away. I wouldn't suggest venturing into Pigalle (that metro is the closest) the area is sketchy at night, but St. Georges metro is around the corner from the hotel. Prepare yourself, the front desk spoke very very little english, and I consider myself knowledgeable in French and it was a challenge for me. Breakfest is included, but limited to orange juice, croissant, butter, tea, jam, etc. I was rarely in my room, so it didn't matter, but the first day I arrived, I was exhausted from arriving from the USA and my room was not ready, so I had to wait in the lobby for two hours. It was cheap, and I might do it again, but that's because I was just in the room to sleep. Great walk everywhere though.

Reviews.Title: “Dated & Basic 2* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: K8Sheffield
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a package with EuroStar. This hotel was VERY basic and the decor was very dated. The receptionist was always sat watching TV in the reception area when we walked through. The satff were not very friendly. The bedroom was very small and again it could do with an update on the decor. The bathroom was fairly clean but again very dated! The walls were very thin, therfefore you could hear everything from the corridor and the room next door!Breakfast - all you got was one (dry) croissant and one (again dry!) piece of french bread each! The breakfast room was very small. The location of the hotel is quite good, but it is a short walk to many of the main sites.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, cramped and shabby!!”
Reviews.Author: murlen
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with a Eurostar package. The hotel was about a 30 min. walk from Gard du Nord. We arrived around 10.30am and left our bags. We were not really impressed but kept telling ourselves that it was only for 1 night. When we checked in later the receptionist was sitting in the lobby/lounge area watching TV and using her laptop. She could not speak English - still we were in France. Each time we contacted reception we felt we were disturbing staff from using their laptops or watching tv. The room was twin not double as booked. We managed to move but the room was shabby and cramped. It was just like a box with a bed in the middle. We The breakfast room was in the basement and very cramped. Think of the smallest macdonald's you have ever been in! Tables laid with individual jam, cheese spread, butter (1 of each). We were then brought a crossant and 6inch piece of bread, coffee and juice. No plates - had to use the table setting. And no room to move. Very tempted to grab our bags and find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do this to yourself”
Reviews.Author: Kopre
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the described location. The description is misleading and I would like to correct some of the distances: Sacre Coer is in 15 minutes walking distance. The Opera and Galeries Lafayette is in 20-30 minutes walking distance. The hotel is located in the district of Pigalle, the Metro station you will be using is the Pagalle station and that is in the middle of prostitutes and red light shops and bars. I visited Paris before and stayed in a small hotel in the Latin Quarter, from where you actually can walk to all main attractions. This time I stayed in this hotel, because I saw much of Paris before, except for the Monmartre and I wanted to be close to it. It is not worth the trouble, you can rather stay in a different location and come and visit. The hotel itself is a two star place, but at the lower end of the 2 stars. It looks cheap, the 24-hour front desk guy sleeps in the lobby, the breakfast room is disguisting, tables not clean and the free included breakfast - you can get a better one for 6 Euros around the corner. The bathroom of our room was so small that the towels fell from the rack each time we opened the door, or the waste basked flipped over. No essential personal hygiene items provided, no hair dryer - only soap. The sink is barely usable - if you want to wash your face, you will cut your forehead with the glass shelf placed over it. We used the glasses and borrowed some plates from the breakfast room, at the end of our stay they were still dirty... I consider myself flexible and tolerant in terms of low budget travel and have traveled many places in the world. This was far the worse hotel I stayed and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: souvankham
Reviews.Content: I went during the off season and Paris was great. The hotel sits at the bottom of the butte of montmatre. It is close to sacre coeur, and pigalle train station. The area is a little shady lots of strip joints near by. So be careful coming back at night. The rooms were very small (typical of paris) and was enough for our needs. The bathroom was very nice, good showers. The heater worked, although we had to sleep with the windows open because there was a stale stench of smoke when we were there. We were on the second floor, the third floor where the others were was so bad that we coughed from the smell of the smoke. I would stay here again because the price is cheap and is close to my favorite area of paris. The front desk was very helpful and courteous. They lock the doors late at night so you have to knock really loud.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little bit small”
Reviews.Author: ABPat
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while in Paris and apart from the room being tiny as it was only meant to be a double room and they had thrown another one in there it was fine. Unfortunately there was no air-con, breakfast was basic but good. No complaints as we weren't really expecting much. Location to Montmatre is really good as it's only a quick walk up the hill and its about 15 minutes to The Opera Garnier. There are a couple of tube stations around so all in all has good links around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Three Ladies from Canada”
Reviews.Author: Franceine
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 week trip to France. We stayed at this hotel on two occasions. The first was when we arrived from Canada. We were given a room on the 5th floor and it was on the street side. It was quite noisy, but late in the evening, the street quietened down. The room was clean, the mattresses were so comfortable, and the room itself was bright, yet cramped for 3 ladies. The breakfasts in the bright and clean cellar dining area were wonderful: baguettes, croissants, butter, creme cheese, jams and coffee, tea or hot chocolate were a great start to every day. We stayed there for 3 nights and moved on to another city after making reservations with the desk clerk, who wrote our request in the book and who understood that we wanted 3 more nights in two weeks time. We left on further adventures assuming the reservations had been made. We returned on the last end of our trip and after a 5 hour high speed train trip, we arrived to find there were no reservations for us. We were extremely upset. However, the manager of the hotel (an Algerian chap) arranged to get us into another hotel a few streets away. It was not an ideal situation, however, we were picked up by him personally!!!! the next day and moved into our "old room" on the 5th floor. Here we stayed for 2 more nights and had a wonderful end to our vacation. The majority of the staff of the hotel do not speak English well, however if you make the effort, they will also try to understand. The manager is wonderful and the cleaning staff do their best to keep a very busy hotel clean. The area is the red light district and the blvd de Clichy is indeed an area that is eye opening in the daytime, but surprisingly, it is safe in the night time as long as you dont linger, or get eye contact with any of the "men".....we were 3 ladies at times and we never had any problems, and never encountered any pick pockets, etc. We were very aware of where our purses were.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but cheerful”
Reviews.Author: julesmayb
Reviews.Content: I was a bit unsure what to expect here 'cos of widely differing reviews but I must say I was pleasantly surprised. Two minutes walk from Pigalle Metro. Yes, it's in the Red Light district but the area is busy and well-lit. I'm sure that if you stood alone on a street corner wearing stilettoes and a short skirt you would eventually be propositioned, but we had no hassle whatsoever. The hotel was basic but clean and comfortable. Remarkably good-quality toilet paper!! Staff weren't the most enthusiastic but spoke good English. Breakfast was basic but plenty of it. Good tea! My one complaint would be lack of storage space in the room. As long as you don't mind living out your suitcase you'd be fine. There was a corner to hang up coats but that was about it. All-in-all I'd definitely go back and stay if I plan another low-budget trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “"smelly" visitor from Ireland”
Reviews.Author: brav0
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Paris. Originally we were booked into this hotel when we booked our trip in Jan. We arrived to the hotel to be told the had no room available for us so we had to go to the hotel next door and return to st.George the next morning.we understood these things happen.finally getting sorted we were so excited and decided to go for a walk.to our surprise we were slap bang in the middle of the red light area (moulin rouge was a 3 min walk) it was soooo sleazy and dirty my image of a romantic weekend in Paris soon faded. We were terrified to go into a bar or restaurant as there were men outside THESE clubs trying to get you in, so we just went back to the hotel and went to bed. The next morning we packed up and went back to saint George where they still had no room ready. We left our bags at reception and headed off sightseeing as enough time had been wasted. On our return we went to our room which was small smelly and only a lamp worked.We turned back went to reception and checked out and went and got another hotel.Between the Horrible Hotel and the Sleazy area I would advise anyone to STAY AWAY.(unless you're into that!) After all that we had a fantastic time in beautiful Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel better than expected”
Reviews.Author: darian1179
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during new years and thought it would be in a seedy area but to my surprise the street was pleasant and quite safe at night. The hotel is clean and quite convenient to all places as it is only a few minutes walk to pigalle metro. The only thing I suggest is to improve the bathroom because there are no curtains in there and the water pressure is really bad and you can't really adjust the water temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Rerrible”
Reviews.Author: Len123456
Reviews.Content: Bare electric wires under the electric fire in the toilet / shower ! Ceiling in shower made of polythene sheeting ! Holes in ceiling in bedroom where lights had previously been fitted stuffed wit toilet roll. Breakfast extremely basic when a seat is available. Nothing to drink day or night. Drinks machine faulty for some months now. Night staff extremely unhelpfull. Day staff very pleasant. Convinced us to try the Ritz next time it must be worht it of only for safety sake !

Reviews.Title: “friendly basic and clean”
Reviews.Author: roxy46
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only one night. Staff were helpful and friendly. The room was basic but clean - and for cheap price i paid i was not expecting more. It is near the red light district (& Moulin Rouge) which was good fun, a bit seedy but not unsafe. I used Trip advisor when making up my mind to book this hotel so thought it fair to leave my comment.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: reb_sei
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 friends recently. We were after a cheap, clean hotel as near to the centre of Paris as we could afford. We booked as part of a package with Eurostar. Upon arrival we collected our keys and we had two twin rooms. The beds were so close together they looked like a double, but were in fact two beds. The sheets were changed daily and we had clean towels in the bathroom for us to use. The room was small, but had everything we needed. the bathroom was small too, but served it's purpose and it was nice to have an en-suite. The road on which the hotel is on is just around the corner from the sex shops and bright lights on Pigalle, but the street is pretty quiet. it was close to the Metro and only a short walk from Gard de Nord. We found it really easy to get about, and the hotel staff were friendly and gave us weather reports each morning! Most of them spoke English, and with our bad French we managed to communicate OK. Breakfast was basic, some bread and croissant and tea/coffee and orange juice, but was OK. it was included in our package price and filled us up until lunchtime. I would recommend this hotel if you are after somewhere cheap, but clean and easy to travel from. I would have liked to stay in one of the posh hotels in Paris, but I was very pleased with the service we were given in this hotel, given the price we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsspikes
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. Reception staff were friendly and able to speak English when our french faltered. It was no problem to leave luggage with them either. Everything in the hotel was compact, small bedroom and ensuite, small breakfast room and 2 person sized lift but room was comfortable (good firm mattress) with a large opening window and a fan, shower etc was fine and breakfast was served efficiently. The lift broke down on the second day and was quickly mended. Our room was at the front of the hotel and despite being on 4th floor it was pretty noisy late into the night and early in the morning. We did have the double glazed windows fully open though and I should think they soundproof well when shut. The location is great, near lots of restaurants and amenities to the East and South, plenty to explore. Metro very close and well linked to main tourist sites. Paris centre and Sacre Coeur etc walkable if you wish. Very handy for Gare du Nord as short metro ride or 15min walk with luggage. Basically, you get what you pay for - at around 95 Euros a night including breakfast, in a good spot, it's bound to be on the lower end of luxury but a good base and perfectly adequate.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel St. Georges Lafayette
HotelInfo.Address: 11 Rue Victor Masse, 75009 Paris, France
